body:
Output of `helm version`:
```
version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.0", GitCommit:"", GitTreeState:"", GoVersion:"go1.12.9"}
```

Output of `kubectl version`:
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"13", GitVersion:"v1.13.9", GitCommit:"3e4f6a92de5f259ef313ad876bb008897f6a98f0", GitTreeState:"archive", BuildDate:"1970-01-01T00:00:01Z", GoVersion:"go1.11.6", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"16", GitVersion:"v1.16.2", GitCommit:"c97fe5036ef3df2967d086711e6c0c405941e14b", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2019-10-15T19:09:08Z", GoVersion:"go1.12.10", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```

Cloud Provider/Platform (AKS, GKE, Minikube etc.): 
Minikube, self-hosted Kubernetes

I have such job:
```
apiVersion: batch/v1
kind: Job
metadata:
  name: db-migrate
  annotations:
    "helm.sh/hook": pre-install,pre-upgrade
    "helm.sh/hook-delete-policy": hook-succeeded
spec:
  template:
    metadata:
      name: db-migrate
    spec:
      restartPolicy: Never
      containers:
        - name: migrade-exmple
          image: alpine:latest
          command: ["sleep", "300"]

```

I install chart with:
```
helm upgrade --install myname . --timeout 3000s
```

After 60s no matter what in the timeout flag I get:
```
Release "myname" does not exist. Installing it now.
Error: failed pre-install: watch closed before UntilWithoutRetry timeout
```
